rb_notes.nodeName: 3. Retrieving the CLI Commands of OSPF
rb_notes.text:
Retrieving the CLI commands of OSPF

This node is designed to retrieve all the details of OSPF except the configurations.
	 
Related Commands:
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco Router, Cisco IOS Switch:
show ip ospf 
show ip ospf database database-summary
show ip ospf interface
show ip ospf virtual-links
show ip ospf neighbor
show ip ospf neighbor detail

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":" 
Check OSPF Running Status

The Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) protocol, defined in RFC 2328, is an Interior Gateway Protocol used to distribute routing information within a single Autonomous System. 

This runbook is designed to check the running status of OSPF and its configuration:
1.	 Highlighting the configuration of OSPF, and the components of it (ABRs, ASBRs, areas and type of area)
2.	 Monitoring the running status of OSPF
3.	 Retrieving the OSPF commands.

 
References:
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0047b2","link":"http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/open-shortest-path-first-ospf/7039-1.html"},"insert":"OSPF Design Guide"},{"insert":"
"}]}

The Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) protocol, defined in RFC 2328, is an Interior Gateway Protocol used to distribute routing information within a single Autonomous System.

3.	 Retrieving the OSPF commands.

 
References:

rb_notes.nodeName: 2. Monitoring the Running Status of OSPF
rb_notes.text:
Monitoring the running status of OSPF

This Qapp is designed to highlight the neighbor count and the routes of OSPF on the Qmap.
 
Required Inputs (from user) :
	Any Qmap
 
Outputs:
	The following statistics of OSPF will be highlighted on the Qmap (keep monitoring)
Number of neighbors of every OSPF device
Number of neighbors of every interface of the OSPF device 
Number of OSPF Routes

Related Commands:
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco Router, Cisco IOS Switch:
show ip ospf neighbor detail
show ip route

The Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) protocol, defined in RFC 2328, is an Interior Gateway Protocol used to distribute routing information within a single Autonomous System. 

This runbook is designed to check the running status of OSPF and its configuration:
1.	 Highlighting the configuration of OSPF, and the components of it (ABRs, ASBRs, areas and type of area)
2.	 Monitoring the running status of OSPF
3.	 Retrieving the OSPF commands.

 
References:
OSPF Design Guide

show ip ospf database database-summary
show ip ospf interface
show ip ospf virtual-links
show ip ospf neighbor
show ip ospf neighbor detail

rb_notes.nodeName: 2. Monitoring the Running Status of OSPF
rb_notes.text:
Monitoring the running status of OSPF

This Qapp is designed to highlight the neighbor count and the routes of OSPF on the Qmap.
 
Required Inputs (from user) :
	Any Qmap
 
Outputs:
	The following statistics of OSPF will be highlighted on the Qmap (keep monitoring)
Number of neighbors of every OSPF device
Number of neighbors of every interface of the OSPF device 
Number of OSPF Routes

Related Commands:
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco Router, Cisco IOS Switch:
show ip ospf neighbor detail
show ip route

rb_notes.nodeName: 2. Monitoring the Running Status of OSPF
rb_notes.text:
Monitoring the running status of OSPF

This Qapp is designed to highlight the neighbor count and the routes of OSPF on the Qmap.
 
Required Inputs (from user) :
	Any Qmap
 
Outputs:
	The following statistics of OSPF will be highlighted on the Qmap (keep monitoring)
Number of neighbors of every OSPF device
Number of neighbors of every interface of the OSPF device 
Number of OSPF Routes

Related Commands:
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco Router, Cisco IOS Switch:
show ip ospf neighbor detail
show ip route
